description: Your next adventure is in Kong City. But you decide to take a quick break to do some donuts.

puzzles.description: Make Dash automatically play a silly sound, play a transport sound, then spin right (left wheel 80 cm/s, right wheel 10 cm/s).
puzzles.introduction: Setting the wheels at different speeds will cause Dash to do a donut!

hints.description: Make sure the Moving Basics state is set to left wheel 80 cm/s and right wheel 10 cm/s. Link the states with Auto cues.

puzzles.description: After spinning right, make Dash wait for 3.0 s then spin left (left wheel 10 cm/s, right wheel 80 cm/s). Then make Dash wait for 3.0 s and spin right again.
puzzles.introduction: Add another donut, and connect them into a loop.

hints.description: Make a loop! Link the two Moving Basics states together with Wait For cues set to 3.0 s.

puzzles.description: While spinning left or spinning right, make Dash say "Oh no!" if Dash gets stuck.
puzzles.introduction: What happens if Dash gets stuck while doing donuts? You can test it by trapping Dash between two objects that Dash can't move.

hints.description: Link the sound with two Stuck cues. Run the program and use your hands to make Dash stop spinning.

puzzles.description: When Dash says "Oh no! make Dash instantly stop.

hints.description: Link the Stop state with an Instant cue.

puzzles.description: Make Dash play the silly sound again when Dash moves forward or moves backward.
puzzles.introduction: When Dash gets stuck, you need to offer a push. You can push Dash forward or backward to start the engines.

hints.description: You can add more than one cue between states! Link the Stop state to the silly sound with Move Forward and Move Backward cues. You can trigger these cues by giving Dash a push.
